title: FBM Affinity Partner Strategist
required_experience:

description:
Job Summary
The Affinity Partner Strategist is accountable for the end-to-end management of our Field Marketing Organizations (FMO) Partners and other Affinity partner channels in the future. The strategist requires good business acumen, legal acuity, product knowledge, project management and organizational skills. These skills, combined with a suite of competencies designed to successfully navigate the enterprise and vendor community, are necessary to build and manage a sustainable and scalable model that reviews and tracks well constructed, mid-complexity solutions and contracts balancing risk and vendor accountabilities. Candidate must be a self -starter who requires minimal supervision in performing assigned tasks and has the ability to comprehend legal, financial and business concepts.

Essential Functions
• The essential functions listed represent the major duties of this role, additional duties may be assigned.
• Supports the Florida Blue Medicare leadership team in designing and executing FMO related business processes which meet critical business objectives. Translates strategies into tactical application for vendor execution.
• Responsible for vendor relationship management, contract execution, contract adherence, contract performance, vendor scorecards, payment reconciliation and continuous improvement initiatives. Manages vendor program performance and adherence to established SLAs, scorecards, ROI.
• Works collaboratively with business stakeholders, Procurement, Compliance, Legal, IT Security, Finance, Product, Actuarial, Sales Compensation and other areas to ensure vendors are held to corporate performance and compliance standards.
• Consults with leadership and appropriate corporate departments to ensure vendor issues are quickly addressed and risks to the company are mitigated.
• Provides input for the vendor program budget and performs vendor invoice reconciliation.

Qualifications

Required Work Experience
5+ years related work experience. Experience Details: Medicare External Distribution

Required Management Experience
3+ years direct supervisory/management experience

Required Education
Related Bachelor’s degree or additional related equivalent work experience

Additional Required Qualifications

Experience in Medicare Advantage Sales Management.
Demonstrated communication and coordination skills managing multiple issues, including communications and planning
Proven ability to manage multiple complex business issues
Training/facilitation experience
Ability to travel 50%

Preferred Education
Master’s degree Or relevant business/managed care experience.

Additional Preferred Qualifications
Vendor Management experience Program management experience Florida 215 Insurance Medicare Certification

General Physical Demands
Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally to move objects. Jobs are sedentary if traversing activities are required only occasionally.

Physical/Environmental Activities
Must be able to travel to multiple locations for work (i.e. travel to attend meetings, events, conferences). Occasionally

What We Offer:
As a Florida Blue employee, you will thrive in our Be Well, Work Well, GuideWell culture where being well as an individual, and working well as a team, are both important in serving our members and communities.

To support your wellbeing, comprehensive benefits are offered. As an employee, you will have access to:

· Medical, dental, vision, life and global travel health insurance;

· Income protection benefits: life insurance, Short- and long-term disability programs;

· Leave programs to support personal circumstances;

· Retirement Savings Plan includes employer contribution and employer match;

· Paid time off, volunteer time off, and 11 holidays

· Additional voluntary benefits available; and

· A comprehensive wellness program
Employee benefits are designed to align with federal and state employment laws. Benefits may vary based on the state in which work is performed. Benefits for intern, part-time and seasonal employees may differ.

To support your financial wellbeing, we offer competitive pay as well as opportunities for incentive or commission compensation. We also conduct regular annual reviews with pay for performance considerations for base pay increases.

Annualized Salary Range: $78,400 - $127,400

Typical Annualized Hiring Range: $78,400 - $98,000- We would likely be looking at a higher salary entry point

Final pay will be determined with consideration of market competitiveness, internal equity, and the job-related knowledge, skills, training, and experience you bring.

We are an Equal Opportunity/Protected Veteran/Disabled Employer committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and equitable culture for our employees and communities.

This section is used for Immigration HR Notices Only.
